questions.question: Which term is also used to describe the Old Stone Age?
Paleolithic cave art indicates which of the following?

choices.answer: A reliance on the environment for survival

questions.question: The Neolithic Revolution occurred at the same time around the globe.
What was (most likely) the first domesticated animal?
Which of the following is not a change brought about by the Neolithic Revolution?
Name the river valley civilization highlighted on the map.
Who built the earliest civilization in lower Mesopotamia?
Which Mesopotamian ruler created the first written law code?
Which of the following was NOT a social class in ancient Mesopotamia?
Name the writing system that developed in the region of Mesopotamia.
What were Mesopotamia's multi-story pyramids called?
Which early civilization was protected by the Red Sea and the Sahara Desert?
Who led the Egyptian government?
Which of the following was not a period of historical ancient Egypt?
This term means "a society in which men hold power."
Egyptian religion was monotheistic.
This early civilization developed in what is now Pakistan.
Which of the following is one of the major cities of the Indus Valley?
This was the first dynasty to rule China.
Rulers in ancient China used these to get guidance from their ancestors.
The Olmec are to ancient Mesoamerica as the _________ are to ancient South America.
Which of the following was an ancient group who developed near the Aegean Sea?
Classical Greece was centered around the development of the _____________.
Which Greek city-state was known for its system of democracy?
The Spartans were known for conquering and taking captives as slaves called ___________.
What is the name for Greek farmers who served as heavily armored infantrymen?
Women of which Greek city-state had more freedom than others?
Who was the first Greek philosopher to focus on ethics and truth?
This ancient empire was founded by Cyrus the Great.
The Persian Empire was divided up into provinces ruled by ______________.
Who succeeded his father to conquer most of the known world circa 330 BCE?
Roman society was divided into which two groups?
Whose reign marked the official beginning of the Roman Empire?
This law code was developed during the Roman Republic.
This term means that the oldest living male was given absolute authority over his family.
Which of the following is NOT a legal invention of the Romans?
Name the Roman emperor who established a second capital to escape nomadic attacks.
Which of the following philosophies did NOT develop in classical China?
This "first emperor" used forced labor to build the first fortifications of the Great Wall.
Which of the following was NOT an accomplishment of Shi Huangdi?
The Qin dynasty is to legalism as the _______ dynasty is to Confucianism.
What social group of classical China held a low social status despite wealth?
In what year did the Han dynasty fall?
Which of the following is NOT a division of classical India's caste system?
Beliefs found in the Vedas and the Upanishads later formed Hinduism.
Emperor Ashoka, who promoted Buddhism, was a ruler of which dynasty?
Which Indian empire was smaller in size and had less control over regional leaders?
The stirrup was invented along which classical trade route?
Which trade route relied on lateen sails to more easily maneuver through strong winds?
Which animal made possible trade across the Sahara Desert?
Which of the following is NOT a Germanic group that took advantage of a weakening Roman Empire?
Which of the following did NOT contribute to the fall of classical empires?
What was the earliest monotheistic religion?
Which religion became the official religion of Rome in 381 CE?
Which religion's supreme deities are Vishnu and Shiva?
This religion teaches the Four Noble Truths and the Eightfold Path.
Which philosophy is based on five basic relationships that define society?
Which religion was founded in the area depicted on the map?
Which of the following is NOT one of the Five Pillars of Faith in Islam?
The conflict over Muhammad's successor led to which two sects?
This Islamic caliphate ruled from its capital in Damascus from 661 to 750.
The Abbasid Dynasty (750-1258) ruled the Islamic world from Baghdad.
These ships with lateen sails carried goods along the Indian Ocean.
Islamic caliphs established urban universities called ________ to preserve ancient writings.
What happened to the political structure of Europe immediately after 476?

choices.answer: Europe was fragmented, which led to the growth of feudalism.
Europe was conquered by the Persians.
Europe was united under William the Conqueror.
Europe developed 3 strong monarchs that ruled the continent.

questions.question: Who was crowned Holy Roman Emperor on Christmas Day, 800?
What is the name for those were tied to manors and protected by the lord of the manor?
This institution continued to gain power throughout medieval Europe.
The idea of limited government was based partly on this document signed in 1215 by King John I.
Pope Urban II called for Christians to reclaim the holy land in 1095, which led to the _______.
This term means "associations of people who work in the same occupation."
The Eastern Roman Empire continued as the ___________ Empire.
The policy of political and religious power concentrated in the emperor's hands is ___________.
Which of the following was NOT a characteristic of Byzantine emperor Justinian's reign?

choices.answer: Efforts to reclaim lost lands of the Roman Empire

questions.question: The patriarch is to Eastern Orthodox as the pope is to _____________.
In Mesoamerica, the Olmec were succeeded by the ________.
Tenochtitlan was the central city of the Maya.
Aztecs from Mesoamerica built their main city, ______________, near Lake Texcoco.
After the Chavin, the __________ thrived in the Andes Mountains.
Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of the Inca?
This dynasty reunited China in 589 CE.
Tang emperors restricted the inheritance of land through the __________________.
During the early Tang dynasty, which religion was especially influential?
This practice that led to female subordination & continued for a centuries began with the Song.
Which of the following are dynasties that ruled postclassical Korea?
What is the name of Japan's native religion?
Name the first novel to be written in Japanese.
Japan's feudal system was dominated by the lords, who were supported by ___________.
Who united the Mongol tribes and took on the name Genghis Khan?
Which of the following was NOT an empire that emerged after Genghis Khan's death?
Which of the following was NOT a result of Mongol rule?

choices.answer: Flourishing trade along the Silk Road
A unified Asian continent that lasted for centuries
Segregation of ethnic groups in China
The spread of the Black Death

questions.question: Which Chinese dynasty succeeded the Mongols and restricted foreign trade?
This term means "master storyteller" and was an advisor to kings of Mali.
Which king of Mali was famous for his pilgrimage to Mecca?
This African kingdom was an island of Christians in a sea of Muslims.
Who went from Venice to the court of Kublai Khan and sparked European interest in Asia?
This traveler wrote a book of his experiences throughout the areas of Dar-al-Islam.
The Silk Roads are to luxury goods as ______________________ is to bulk goods.
Which religions emphasized the use of missionaries to travel and encourage conversion?
Which of the following was NOT a major trade city during the postclassical era?
